summary: The two remaining iteration-2 blockers (invalid DO/COMMIT backfill pattern and cross-tenant admin_audit_log readability by app_role) are fixed correctly, and no new truly blocking issues were introduced by the changes.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Migration 0012 Phase 2 backfill used DO $$ ... COMMIT; inside loop (invalid in PostgreSQL)
previous_issues_status.notes: The SDD now correctly states that DO blocks cannot COMMIT, and replaces the guidance with (a) an application/psql batch loop using UPDATE ... LIMIT ... FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED with per-iteration commits, and (b) an optional CREATE PROCEDURE approach where COMMIT is valid. This resolves the operational correctness and online/backfill safety requirement.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: admin_audit_log privilege model allowed app_role SELECT with no RLS (cross-tenant audit log exposure)
previous_issues_status.notes: The SDD now explicitly REVOKEs ALL from app_role and GRANTs INSERT only, with SELECT reserved for a separate audit_reader_role. This removes the cross-tenant read exposure and matches the stated platform-level audit intent.
